items.creator: Sergiu Gatlan
items.title: BT unit took servers offline after Black Basta ransomware breach
items.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
items.content: Multinational telecommunications giant BT Group (formerly British Telecom) has confirmed that its BT Conferencing business division shut down some of its servers following a Black Basta ransomware breach. [...]
items.contentSnippet: Multinational telecommunications giant BT Group (formerly British Telecom) has confirmed that its BT Conferencing business division shut down some of its servers following a Black Basta ransomware breach. [...]

items.creator: Bill Toulas
items.title: New DroidBot Android banking malware spreads across Europe
items.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
items.content: A new Android banking malware named 'DroidBot' attempts to steal credentials for over 77 cryptocurrency exchanges and banking apps in the UK, Italy, France, Spain, and Portugal. [...]
items.contentSnippet: A new Android banking malware named 'DroidBot' attempts to steal credentials for over 77 cryptocurrency exchanges and banking apps in the UK, Italy, France, Spain, and Portugal. [...]

items.creator: Lawrence Abrams
items.title: Solana Web3.js library backdoored to steal secret, private keys
items.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
items.content: The legitimate Solana JavaScript SDK was temporarily compromised yesterday in a supply chain attack, with the library backdoored with malicious code to steal cryptocurrency private keys and drain wallets. [...]
items.contentSnippet: The legitimate Solana JavaScript SDK was temporarily compromised yesterday in a supply chain attack, with the library backdoored with malicious code to steal cryptocurrency private keys and drain wallets. [...]

items.creator: Bill Toulas
items.title: Russian hackers hijack Pakistani hackers' servers for their own attacks
items.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
items.content: The notorious Russian cyber-espionage group Turla is hacking other hackers, hijacking the Pakistani threat actor Storm-0156's infrastructure to launch their own covert attacks on already compromised networks. [...]
items.contentSnippet: The notorious Russian cyber-espionage group Turla is hacking other hackers, hijacking the Pakistani threat actor Storm-0156's infrastructure to launch their own covert attacks on already compromised networks. [...]

items.creator: Bill Toulas
items.title: Japan warns of IO-Data zero-day router flaws exploited in attacks
items.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
items.content: Japan's CERT is warning that hackers are exploiting zero-day vulnerabilities in I-O Data router devices to modify device settings, execute commands, or even turn off the firewall. [...]
items.contentSnippet: Japan's CERT is warning that hackers are exploiting zero-day vulnerabilities in I-O Data router devices to modify device settings, execute commands, or even turn off the firewall. [...]

items.creator: Sponsored by Specops Software
items.title: Six password takeaways from the updated NIST cybersecurity framework
items.dc:creator: Sponsored by Specops Software
items.content: Updated NIST guidelines reject outdated password security practices in favor of more effective protections. Learn from Specops Software about 6 takeaways from NIST's new guidance that help create strong password policies. [...]
items.contentSnippet: Updated NIST guidelines reject outdated password security practices in favor of more effective protections. Learn from Specops Software about 6 takeaways from NIST's new guidance that help create strong password policies. [...]

items.creator: Sergiu Gatlan
items.title: Vodka maker Stoli files for bankruptcy in US after ransomware attack
items.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
items.content: Stoli Group's U.S. companies have filed for bankruptcy following an August ransomware attack and Russian authorities seizing the company's remaining distilleries in the country. [...]
items.contentSnippet: Stoli Group's U.S. companies have filed for bankruptcy following an August ransomware attack and Russian authorities seizing the company's remaining distilleries in the country. [...]

items.creator: Bill Toulas
items.title: Cloudflare’s developer domains increasingly abused by threat actors
items.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
items.content: Cloudflare's 'pages.dev' and 'workers.dev' domains, used for deploying web pages and facilitating serverless computing, are being increasingly abused by cybercriminals for phishing and other malicious activities. [...]
items.contentSnippet: Cloudflare's 'pages.dev' and 'workers.dev' domains, used for deploying web pages and facilitating serverless computing, are being increasingly abused by cybercriminals for phishing and other malicious activities. [...]

items.creator: Sergiu Gatlan
items.title: US shares tips to block hackers behind recent telecom breaches
items.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
items.content: ​CISA released guidance today to help network defenders harden their systems against attacks coordinated by the Salt Typhoon Chinese threat group that breached multiple major global telecommunications providers earlier this year. [...]
items.contentSnippet: ​CISA released guidance today to help network defenders harden their systems against attacks coordinated by the Salt Typhoon Chinese threat group that breached multiple major global telecommunications providers earlier this year. [...]

items.creator: Bill Toulas
items.title: Exploit released for critical WhatsUp Gold RCE flaw, patch now
items.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
items.content: A proof-of-concept (PoC) exploit for a critical-severity remote code execution flaw in Progress WhatsUp Gold has been published, making it critical to install the latest security updates as soon as possible. [...]
items.contentSnippet: A proof-of-concept (PoC) exploit for a critical-severity remote code execution flaw in Progress WhatsUp Gold has been published, making it critical to install the latest security updates as soon as possible. [...]

items.creator: Sergiu Gatlan
items.title: Veeam warns of critical RCE bug in Service Provider Console
items.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
items.content: ​Veeam released security updates today to address two Service Provider Console (VSPC) vulnerabilities, including a critical remote code execution (RCE) discovered during internal testing. [...]
items.contentSnippet: ​Veeam released security updates today to address two Service Provider Console (VSPC) vulnerabilities, including a critical remote code execution (RCE) discovered during internal testing. [...]

items.creator: Bill Toulas
items.title: Police seizes largest German online crime marketplace, arrests admin
items.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
items.content: Germany has taken down the largest online cybercrime marketplace in the country, named "Crimenetwork," and arrested its administrator for facilitating the sale of drugs, stolen data, and illegal services. [...]
items.contentSnippet: Germany has taken down the largest online cybercrime marketplace in the country, named "Crimenetwork," and arrested its administrator for facilitating the sale of drugs, stolen data, and illegal services. [...]

items.creator: Sergiu Gatlan
items.title: FTC bans data brokers from selling Americans’ sensitive location data
items.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
items.content: Today, the FTC banned data brokers Mobilewalla and Gravy Analytics from harvesting and selling Americans' location tracking data linked to sensitive locations, like churches, healthcare facilities, military installations, and schools. [...]
items.contentSnippet: Today, the FTC banned data brokers Mobilewalla and Gravy Analytics from harvesting and selling Americans' location tracking data linked to sensitive locations, like churches, healthcare facilities, military installations, and schools. [...]

items.creator: Bill Toulas
items.title: Police seize Matrix encrypted chat service after spying on criminals
items.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
items.content: An international law enforcement operation codenamed 'Operation Passionflower' has shut down MATRIX, an encrypted messaging platform used by cybercriminals to coordinate illegal activities while evading police. [...]
items.contentSnippet: An international law enforcement operation codenamed 'Operation Passionflower' has shut down MATRIX, an encrypted messaging platform used by cybercriminals to coordinate illegal activities while evading police. [...]

items.creator: Bill Toulas
items.title: Korea arrests CEO for adding DDoS feature to satellite receivers
items.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
items.content: South Korean police have arrested a CEO and five employees for manufacturing over 240,000 satellite receivers pre-loaded or later updated to include DDoS attack functionality at a purchaser's request. [...]
items.contentSnippet: South Korean police have arrested a CEO and five employees for manufacturing over 240,000 satellite receivers pre-loaded or later updated to include DDoS attack functionality at a purchaser's request. [...]

items.creator: Sergiu Gatlan
items.title: Russia sentences Hydra dark web market leader to life in prison
items.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
items.content: Russian authorities have sentenced the leader of the criminal group behind the now-closed dark web platform Hydra Market to life in prison. [...]
items.contentSnippet: Russian authorities have sentenced the leader of the criminal group behind the now-closed dark web platform Hydra Market to life in prison. [...]

items.creator: Bill Toulas
items.title: BootKitty UEFI malware exploits LogoFAIL to infect Linux systems
items.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
items.content: The recently uncovered 'Bootkitty' UEFI bootkit, the first malware of its kind targeting Linux systems, exploits CVE-2023-40238, aka 'LogoFAIL,' to infect computers running on a vulnerable UEFI firmware. [...]
items.contentSnippet: The recently uncovered 'Bootkitty' UEFI bootkit, the first malware of its kind targeting Linux systems, exploits CVE-2023-40238, aka 'LogoFAIL,' to infect computers running on a vulnerable UEFI firmware. [...]

items.creator: Mayank Parmar
items.title: Mozilla really wants you to set Firefox as default Windows browser
items.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
items.content: In an effort to turn the tide, Mozilla is testing a fresh approach that could persuade more people to switch their default browser on Windows during the installation of the browser. [...]
items.contentSnippet: In an effort to turn the tide, Mozilla is testing a fresh approach that could persuade more people to switch their default browser on Windows during the installation of the browser. [...]
